bypass.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a road that goes around a town or other busy area rather than through it
bypass.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a tube that allows gas or liquid to flow around something rather than through it
bypass.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to go around a town or other busy place rather than through it
bypass.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Interstate 8 bypasses the town to the north.
bypass.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to avoid obeying a rule, system, or someone in an official position
bypass.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Francis bypassed his manager and wrote straight to the director.
bypass.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to avoid something such as a law, rule, or system, or to avoid involving someone in a process
bypass.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Companies will always try to bypass laws aimed at protecting workersâ€™ rights.
Customers can buy direct from producers and bypass the middleman.
